body:

Almost looked like the dead zone in the Cod:WaW MPmap. 

SAD AF YO. adc2k17

We have only ever had 5 marksmen viable at most at the same time, this is a golden rule that has been around for the last seasons.

So naturally these 5 have a high popularity number. 

Unlike say midlane, toplane or jungle, where you have a rotation of classes going on.

Naturally in a lane where 2 or more roles are viable the popularity for either will decrease  as long as they aren't too far apart in effectiveness since they are effectively "sharing" the playrates for that lane. And the shares get smaller for each role that get's generally played in that lane. Oh and for every champion too. 

Or did you fail to consider that completely?


Thus it's only natural that marksmen, having the least amount of champions played, having their own lane, will have higher popularity on each of their currently played members. '

Because no one wants to play something thats weaker by choice right? It only hurts the team you are playing with after all. 

A little less than double the playrate is about right with 5 viable marksmen compared to your average popular tank or mage.


That does of course reduce the winrates on them.....however it also becomes exceedingly easy to tell if any one of them might be too strong,  all you need to to is see if any of them pulls ahead of the others in terms of winrate and playrate.

oh yes, it is twitch,what a unexpected find, the only marksman in the top 20.....no actually wait, kog has moved up 4 steps from 22 to 18...possible alert on this one too.....altho only in diamond.

And pretty much every other ADC had a sub 50% winrate so.

Ok, look here, before spouting bullshit, could you at least do some research?

Want to know why every adc is at around 50% winrate? That is because in every game there are 2 adc's. MEANING that one of them will win, and the other one lose. Thus, unlike with other classes, the winrates of adc's are ALWAYS around 50% unless there are some extra cases. Winrate is NOT an argument if you refuse to look at the context BEHIND that argument.

And yes, cait WAS overpowered, the fact that she has been overnerfed does not change that fact. You also refuse to look at the meta changes that happened and the adc's that surfaced currently.

Also, cut off on the strawmen. Cait was picked a lot, that is right. But that is not why she was disliked, she was disliked because she lacked weaknesses and was not interactive for the power she had. Can you tell me the reason why champions become popular in a meta? It is because they are either strong or TOO strong. People take what they know is better and win them more games.

So, before writing any other comment, please, learn more about how the game works, how meta shifts work, and what CONTEXT means.

>MEANING that one of them will win, and the other one lose.

That's awfully convenient, you can ignore when the majority of ADCs are getting pounded by e.g. Caitlyn but she and the likes of Twitch are all "broken messes". Or since the same argument applies to junglers, when Lee has a +50% winrate he's broken and when he has >50% winrate, he's broken. See? Now that could be a strawman, if you didn't think it.
>Can you tell me the reason why champions become popular in a meta?

They're reliable and versatile. There you go. Then people in soloQ play them because they saw other people play them. Then people in soloQ see them picked a lot and assume they're broken. 

>People take what they know is better and win them more games.

I hate to say no but. In the "current meta", people pick Twitch, assuming he's broken, and feed on him. It used to be Vayne. Or Yasuo. Or Riven. Or Zed. Or Lee.
>she was disliked because she lacked weaknesses and was not interactive for the power she had.

She never was, Cait's weakness was always her midgame (which people didn't play for) and sorry, she was disliked for being a pubstomper. She could line your turret with traps if she won lane against you and any engage you had was afk. 

Or she was disliked because she was the only ADC that posed  a threat to other roles.

She wasn't any more broken than Yasuo or Zed, who were nerfed *solely* because of their banrates.

> That's awfully convenient, you can ignore when the majority of ADCs are getting pounded by e.g. Caitlyn but she and the likes of Twitch are all "broken messes". Or you since the same argument applies to junglers, when Lee has a +50% winrate he's broken and when he has >50% winrate, he's broken. See? Now that could be a strawman, if you didn't think it.

You still fail to understand the game it seems. Same argument does not apply to any other lane in the game, because they are inhabited by many different classes of champions. There is only one class that is the bottom carry class, and that is the adc.

As a jungler you can see tanks/bruisers/assasins/mages/adc's thus the winrate and playrate of champions is affected by that. However the bottom carry role has only the adc class in it, thus in every game you will see at least 2 adc's. And one will inevitably lose, leading to many adc's having near 50% winrates EVEN if they are unbalanced.

Again, i ask you to do some research in how winrates operate and how context matters, because you still seem to not be able to grasp that concept.
> 
> They're reliable and versatile. There you go. Then people in soloQ play them because they saw other people play them. Then people in soloQ see them picked a lot and assume they're broken. 

Your argument operates on circular logic. "Why do people play a champion? Because they saw others play it" Its circular logic fallacy. The reason why champions become popular in a meta is because they are strong in a certain meta, or due to certain meta changes become too strong and thus allow people to win more games on the back of the champion. Currently janna is a great example of that.

People in soloq play certain champions at a high rate because those champions are good and in the meta. This knowledge comes from experience and yes, looking at others, because you can observe a champions strenght without playing that champion.



> I hate to say no but. In the "current meta", people pick Twitch, assuming he's broken, and feed on him. It used to be Vayne. Or Yasuo. Or Riven. Or Zed. Or Lee.

Some people will always suck on certain champions even if they are op. Tell me, was Kassawin (Prenerf) a completely balanced champion if someone sucked with him? No, he was the most broken champion in the history of league. Someone being able to lose with an op champion, does not make that champion not op. One of the more notable example in this is Azir, who was broken due to his kit, yet due to his high skillcap only good players could abuse it.

> She never was, Cait's weakness was always her midgame (which people didn't play for) and sorry, she was disliked for being a pubstomper. She could line your turret with traps if she won lane against you and any engage you had was afk.
> 
> Or she was disliked because she was the only ADC that posed a threat to other roles.
> 
> She wasn't any more broken than Yasuo or Zed, who were nerfed solely because of their banrates.

OLD cait weakness was midgame, not the current ones. The current cait thrives at all times of play, she was disliked for being unfair to play against, i know, i was here and saw the threads. Master yi is also a pubstomper, i don't see threads about him. That is because being a pubstomp champ is not a problem.

She was not the only threathening adc, however, she was too strong for what she had. She had no proper weaknesses to exploit. And she was more broken than zed or yasuo, both of which were nerfed for more than one reason, which you seem to not know.

Please, i will repeat again. Do some research before talking, because not only can you not grasp basic concepts as how winrate operates, you do not even know the context of balance changes you talk about, nor do you know the metas you are talking about.

> Again, i ask you to do some research in how winrates operate and how context matters, because you still seem to not be able to grasp that concept.

You're arbitrarily dividing champions into classes instead of roles. Some champions are only played in the jungle, in fact, being played in both jungle and somewhere else is incredibly rare. You should have the same 50% average, at least roughly.
> Your argument operates on circular logic. "Why do people play a champion? Because they saw others play it" Its circular logic fallacy. 

Ah, if only I hadn't also said that thing about them being reliable and versatile, then that would be true.
>The reason why champions become popular in a meta is because they are strong in a certain meta, or due to certain meta changes become too strong and thus allow people to win more games on the back of the champion. 

That's not wrong but that's not the only factor and quite frankly the people on these forums are blatantly ignoring any successful champion that isn't an AD damage dealer when they complain about champions.
>Currently janna is a great example of that.

Lol, "*currently* Janna", the most overpicked soloQ support for years is "currently" being abused.
> People in soloq play certain champions at a high rate because those champions are good and in the meta. This knowledge comes from experience and yes, looking at others, because you can observe a champions strenght without playing that champion.
> 
> Some people will always suck on certain champions even if they are op. Tell me, was Kassawin (Prenerf) a completely balanced champion if someone sucked with him? No, he was the most broken champion in the history of league. 

And winning with him was notably easier too and these people here say that all there is to playing ADC is getting RNG crits and rightclicking. Are you telling me they're wrong?
>Someone being able to lose with an op champion, does not make that champion not op. One of the more notable example in this is Azir, who was broken due to his kit, yet due to his high skillcap only good players could abuse it.

It would also be reflected in "oh they picked Azir, let's see if the enemy team can win" being said at high levels of play, which isn't the case with Twitch or any other random champions that people circlejerk against.
> OLD cait weakness was midgame, not the current ones. The current cait thrives at all times of play, she was disliked for being unfair to play against, i know, i was here and saw the threads. 

That is so insightful; "unfair to play against". Incredible research.
>Master yi is also a pubstomper, i don't see threads about him. That is because being a pubstomp champ is not a problem.

If Yi was picked a lot, you bet there would be complaints about him. Although they might be more muted because a jungler doesn't bully you. People wouldn't notice him, even though he'd be a dominating factor.
> She was not the only threathening adc, however, she was too strong for what she had. She had no proper weaknesses to exploit. 

You mean outside of having more damage than her during the midgame if you didn't walk into her traps?
>both of which were nerfed for more than one reason, which you seem to not know.

Lol sure, reasons like "they have a Q that can damage me when I do things normally do" or "they have a passive, nerf that!". I was there too, that's all there was. Prove me wrong.
> Please, i will repeat again. Do some research before talking, because not only can you not grasp basic concepts as how winrate operates, you do not even know the context of balance changes you talk about, nor do you know the metas you are talking about.

I do know, every time I see a thread complaining about a champion they complain about some part of their kit that clearly doesn't matter if you play well. Or that ignores certain irremovable factors in the game. Like  a duo or trio of overpicked ADCs.

Classes and roles are two different things. Many junglers can be played top lane. Many top laners can be played jungle. Many mids can be played top and vice versa. That is not the only thing, for example, even if one class has only one role, that does not mean that the role has only one class. For example the role of the midlaner can be covered by at least 3 classes without even counting subclasses. Same with other roles besides the bottom carry role.

The bottom carry role has only one class that is played there, the adc, and it is not changeable to any other class. Thus winrates of the adc class always center around 50% no matter how broken or not they are.

For example, im midlane, if assasins become the top dogs, their winrate will skyrocket while the other classes winrate will plummet, because midlane is inhabited by many different classes.

And yes, i agree champ power is not the only thing influencing its popularity, however in terms of meta, that factor is one of the most important ones. Currently many champions are ignored and the focus is on the adc's because the boards and humans have a one track mind. They want to fix the current problem and then move on from there. While i agree that adc's might not bwe the only problems in the game, until we fix THAT problem, we cannt really move on to others, because every fix will have some consequences and yet again change the meta.

Also, janna has not been the most overpicked support, that title belongs to thresh. Janna has always had a good winrate and playrate due to the nature of her kit, not because she is op. However the buffs to coin, ardent and the overall synergy with those items paired with the increased strenght of the adcs pushed janna overboard in this season.

I do not agree that adc as a class does not require skill. It does, it is more than right cicking. The problem is that currently, it is not as seen as previously. Again, when was the last time you actually saw an assasin in your game? Because every adc counter is so incredibly weak right now, they are running rampart and their skill requirement has fallen from where it was previously.

I am summarizing caits problems into a few phrases because this is not a cait discussion, many people and me included have already listed her problems many times on the boards, and she had many.

And again, popularity is not the thing that makes people go against those champs and calling them op. Popularity is directly tied to champion power. As such again, if a champ is indeed unbalanced he will become popular, you have to make a distinction about why people complain about champs, and it is not popularity. There have been many popular champs that have not been complained about.

Again, traps were not the main source of damage of cait, since she could proc her headshots from many other ways including her mobility spell. Saying that others had more damage than her in midgame is simply false, becuase her damage even without headshots was high.

And no, complaints about zed and yasuo were far better explained, but you seemed to ignore them for the sake of your argumentation. While yes, there were  some stupid threads talking shite, there were just as many threads talking extensivelly about these problems.

Adc's are not an ireemovable factor of this game. if the game was properly balanced they would be removable and interchangeable. Best example of that is dota, even Hots and Smite have gotten that right.

And as I've said, junglers being played in the toplane are an exception, not the rule. Buuut I can kind of see your logic now. Wow, an actual argument for how ADCs are (or well, could be) broken ,despite of all the champions that are doing a better than them, and it isn't their pickrate and it only took me months to find one!

Regardless, onto disagreeing with you. I do appreciate you laying out your arguments for me like this though. Really. ^_^

If we "fix" the current ADCs, can you guess what will happen? That's right, different ADCs with a dominating winrate and pickrate will pop up. That's literally always how it's been and quite frankly, that's what *you're* ignoring.

The only popular champions who don't get complained about are the ones whose input is incremental. Janna is a great example of this. The fact that ADCs have to be picked every game and as such, have higher pickrates than champions who outperform them, which are *countless*, is why they're considered a "balance issue" here.

Want another example? Consider Lucian or Corki mid. Abyssmal winrates, literally nothing broken about them but "oh look at how OP ADCs are, they're getting picked mid!" Or Thresh! 

No, I'm not ignoring any complaints about Zed or Yas. The only upvoted threads were "look at their banrates! The new Kassadin!" and some passive aggressive ramblings about Yasuo killing you with his ... "tank" build. As if bruisers building tank items was some sort of novelty. Zed had already been gutted repeatedly, so even this forum couldn't come up with more things to hate. They just didn't like what little kill pressure he had left. There were other complaints? 
*D o   t e l l.* (And don't bring up Wind Wall, just don't.)

What you're saying kind of implies that Caitlyn did huge (midgame) damage without her only AA roid, erm, wut? Her only damage sources outside of her headshot are her Q, her R and technically her range. 

An assassin in my games? Last time I queued up for normals. And what about Talon? In all seriousness, if the nerfed assassins are the reason for this anti-ADC circlejerk then that's some delicious irony. Because this community is entirely the reason why they all got and get gutted. 

DotA's balance is imbalance. One OP thing counters the other. That's not the direction LoL is going in.
As far as I know, HotS has its own version of Herald accessible from minute 0 (multiple times). You really want that in LoL?
LoL has had around 5 seasons of ADCs and any deviation from that hasn't exactly been the epitome of balance. But do elaborate, what would a balanced version of LoL look like?
For a role that many here consider easy, it's amazing how many people are so bad at it.

Okay so all the tops, mids, jgs and supps are all god adc's and they don't play it because of preference.  I'll just take your word for that.  Also, how is "expecting a good support" a valid strategy to climb as adc?  Have you ever played adc?  The odds of getting a good support are maybe 2/10 at best.  Why aren't all challenger players adc if it's such an op and easy role?  Preference?  Ah, all the other roles just prefer working 10x harder than the easy adc role.  You've opened my eyes!

I mean I just don't find adcs to be very fun to play.  Autoattacks aren't interesting gameplay to me.  I instead find skillshots to be extremely fun to use (predicting opponents is highly entertaining, especially if they're in the fog of war).

Thus I main mages, Xerath most of all as he is 100% skillshots and feels extremely rewarding to play well.  The only adcs I find entertaining are Ezreal and Jhin.  Adc is actually my second favorite role mostly because it is the other primary carry role and those two champions are still fun to me.

I'm not saying adc is easy as hell to win with or that if I mained adc I'd be a god.  I'm just pointing out that preference does play some part in people not playing adcs.
